author: travelandtourworld.com
title: US visaTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Police bust Brazilian ring that counterfeited documents to obtain US visas  
A criminal organization, that forged documents needed to obtain a US entry visa, was dismantled by Brazilian police, Brazilian authorities said on Wednesday.
Four people identified as Valeria Cristina Kowalski, Gradinor Gonçalves Travasso, Jean da Cruz Rocha, Nayara Martinez Auxiliadora and Osimar Barros de Souza were arrested Tuesday in Rio de Janeiro on charges of fraud and criminal conspiracy.
According to a police statement, U.S. authorities are pursuing the investigation on their soil and will likely make arrests soon, while the Brazilians who obtained visas with the gang’s help will be deported.
Besides providing documents, Kowalski put up clients in her home for up to two weeks, coaching them on how to respond to questions during their interviews at the U.S.
Consulate, police inspector Andrea Nunes said in a statement.
Clients were charged a minimum of US$7,000 and the fee was paid to another member of the ring based in the United States, Nunes said.
